name: AzureSql
help: Manage Azure SQL Databases and Data Warehouses.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: Usage
properties.help: Name of usage metric to return.

properties.name: ManagedInstance
properties.help: Name of the Azure SQL managed instance.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the Azure SQL Managed Database.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Collation
properties.help: The collation of the Azure SQL Managed Database collation to use, e.g.: SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS or Latin1_General_100_CS_AS_SC.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: ManagedInstance
properties.help: Name of the Azure SQL managed instance.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the Azure SQL Managed Database.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Yes
properties.help: Do not prompt for confirmation.

properties.name: ManagedInstance
properties.help: Name of the Azure SQL managed instance.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: DestName
properties.help: Name of the managed database that will be created as the restore destination.

properties.name: ManagedInstance
properties.help: Name of the Azure SQL managed instance.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the Azure SQL Managed Database.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: DestMi
properties.help: Name of the managed instance to restore managed database to. This can be same managed instance, or another managed instance on same subscription. When not specified it defaults to source managed instance.

properties.name: DestResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of the resource group of the managed instance to restore managed database to. When not specified it defaults to source resource group.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Time
properties.help: The point in time of the source database that will be restored to create the new database. Must be greater than or equal to the source database's earliestRestoreDate value. Time should be in following format: "YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS".

properties.name: ManagedInstance
properties.help: Name of the Azure SQL managed instance.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the Azure SQL Managed Database.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: AdminPassword
properties.help: The administrator login password (required for managed instance creation).

properties.name: AdminUser
properties.help: Administrator username for the managed instance. Can only be specified when the managed instance is being created (and is required for creation).

properties.name: Location
properties.help: Location. You can configure the default location using `az configure --defaults location=&lt;location&gt;`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The managed instance name.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Subnet
properties.help: Name or ID of the subnet that allows access to an Azure Sql Managed Instance. If subnet name is provided, --vnet-name must be provided.

properties.name: AssignIdentity
properties.help: Generate and assign an Azure Active Directory Identity for this managed instance for use with key management services like Azure KeyVault.

properties.name: Capacity
properties.help: The capacity of the managed instance in vcores.

properties.name: LicenseType
properties.help: The license type to apply for this managed instance.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Storage
properties.help: The storage size of the managed instance. Storage size must be specified in increments of 32 GB.

properties.name: VnetName
properties.help: The virtual network name.

properties.name: Edition
properties.help: The edition component of the sku. Allowed value is GeneralPurpose.

properties.name: Family
properties.help: The compute generation component of the sku. Allowed values include: Gen4, Gen5.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The managed instance name.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Yes
properties.help: Do not prompt for confirmation.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The managed instance name.

properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: AdminPassword
properties.help: The administrator login password (required for managed instance creation).

properties.name: AssignIdentity
properties.help: Generate and assign an Azure Active Directory Identity for this managed instance for use with key management services like Azure KeyVault. If identity is already assigned - do nothing.

properties.name: Capacity
properties.help: The capacity of the managed instance in vcores.

properties.name: LicenseType
properties.help: The license type to apply for this managed instance.

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Storage
properties.help: The storage size of the managed instance. Storage size must be specified in increments of 32 GB.

properties.name: Add
properties.help: Add an object to a list of objects by specifying a path and key value pairs.  Example: --add property.listProperty <key=value, string or JSON string>.

properties.name: ForceString
properties.help: When using 'set' or 'add', preserve string literals instead of attempting to convert to JSON.

properties.name: Remove
properties.help: Remove a property or an element from a list.  Example: --remove property.list <indexToRemove> OR --remove propertyToRemove.

properties.name: Set
properties.help: Update an object by specifying a property path and value to set.  Example: --set property1.property2=<value>.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the elastic pool.

properties.name: ResourceGroup
properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Server
properties.help: Name of the Azure SQL server. You can configure the default using `az configure --defaults sql-server=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: DbDtuMax
properties.help: The maximum capacity (in DTUs or vcores) any one database can consume.

properties.name: DbDtuMin
properties.help: The minumum capacity (in DTUs or vcores) each database is guaranteed.

properties.name: LicenseType
properties.help: The license type to apply for this elastic pool.

properties.name: MaxSize
properties.help: The max storage size. If no unit is specified, defaults to bytes (B).

properties.name: NoWait
properties.help: Do not wait for the long-running operation to finish.

properties.name: Tags
properties.help: Space-separated tags in 'key[=value]' format. Use "" to clear existing tags.

properties.help: Specifies whether to enable zone redundancy.

properties.name: DeletedTime
properties.help: If specified, restore from a deleted database instead of from an existing database. Must match the deleted time of a deleted database in the same server. Either --time or --deleted-time (or both) must be specified.

properties.name: Time
properties.help: The point in time of the source database that will be restored to create the new database. Must be greater than or equal to the source database's earliestRestoreDate value. Either --time or --deleted-time (or both) must be specified.

properties.name: ServiceObjective
properties.help: The name of the new service objective. If this is a standalone db service objective and the db is currently in an elastic pool, then the db is removed from the pool.

properties.name: Add

properties.help: Update an object by specifying a property path and value to set.  Example: --set property1.property2=<value>.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the Failover Group.

properties.name: PartnerServer
properties.help: The name of the partner server of a Failover Group.

properties.help: Name of resource group. You can configure the default group using `az configure --defaults group=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: Server
properties.help: Name of the Azure SQL server. You can configure the default using `az configure --defaults sql-server=&lt;name&gt;`.

properties.name: AddDb
properties.help: List of databases to add to Failover Group.

properties.name: FailoverPolicy
properties.help: The failover policy of the Failover Group.

properties.name: GracePeriod
properties.help: Interval in hours before automatic failover is initiated if an outage occurs on the primary server. This indicates that Azure SQL Database will not initiate automatic failover before the grace period expires. Please note that failover operation with AllowDataLoss option might cause data loss due to the nature of asynchronous synchronization.

properties.name: PartnerResourceGroup
properties.help: The name of the resource group of the partner server.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the Failover Group.

properties.name: ResourceGroup

properties.name: GracePeriod
properties.help: Interval in hours before automatic failover is initiated if an outage occurs on the primary server. This indicates that Azure SQL Database will not initiate automatic failover before the grace period expires. Please note that failover operation with AllowDataLoss option might cause data loss due to the nature of asynchronous synchronization.

properties.name: RemoveDb
properties.help: List of databases to remove from Failover Group.

properties.help: The unique ID of the Azure AD administrator.

properties.name: Add
properties.help: Add an object to a list of objects by specifying a path and key value pairs.  Example: --add property.listProperty <key=value, string or JSON string>.

properties.name: ForceString
properties.help: When using 'set' or 'add', preserve string literals instead of attempting to convert to JSON.

properties.name: Remove
properties.help: Remove a property or an element from a list.  Example: --remove property.list <indexToRemove> OR --remove propertyToRemove.

properties.name: Set
properties.help: Update an object by specifying a property path and value to set.  Example: --set property1.property2=<value>.

commonTaskProperties.name: Debug
commonTaskProperties.help: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs.

commonTaskProperties.name: Help
commonTaskProperties.help: Show this help message and exit.

commonTaskProperties.name: Query
commonTaskProperties.help: JMESPath query string. See http://jmespath.org/ for more information and examples.

commonTaskProperties.name: Verbose
commonTaskProperties.help: Increase logging verbosity. Use --debug for full debug logs.
